ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

Notes: 1 = Yes ; 0 = No ; 888 = Not assessed - patient was ineligible

ElementDescription: Has participant had a Coronary Revascularization (PCI, CABG)?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes > 6 months ago; 2= Yes <6 months ago

ElementDescription: Has participant had a Carotid Endarterectomy or Carotid Stenting?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes > 6 months ago; 2= Yes <6 months ago

ElementDescription: Has participant had Peripheral Artery Disease (PAD) with revascularization?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes > 6 months ago; 2= Yes <6 months ago

ElementDescription: Has participant had acute coronary syndrome with or without resting ECG change, ECG changes on a graded exercise test, or positive cardiac imaging study?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes > 6 months ago; 2= Yes <6 months ago

ElementDescription: Has participant had a prior stroke documented on brain imaging or with a persistent deficit?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes > 6 months ago; 2= Yes <6 months ago

ElementDescription: Does participant have at least 50% diameter stenosis of a coronary, carotid, or lower extremity artery?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes > 6 months ago; 2= Yes <6 months ago
